description.narrative:
Burkina Faso genomför under 2016-2018 en folk- och bostadsräkning. Folkräkningen är en totalundersökning av alla som befinner sig i landet under en avgränsad period (ungefär en vecka) och är en strikt reglerad, administrativt tung och kostsam aktivitet som endast genomförs vart tionde år. Samtidigt är statistiken och den metadata man får från framför allt kartografin helt central för statistikproduktionen i landet för de kommande åren och därmed en investering som anses viktig för såväl samhällplanering som ansvarsutkrävande.
Ambassaden förordar här ett stöd direkt till den burkinska staten med statistikbyrån INSD som genomförare av insatsen. Stödet under 2016 kommer främst att användas för kartografiövningen som producerar kartor över regioner,städer och samhällen för att sedan dela in dessa i olika räkningsområden - en planeringsfas inför själva räkningen. Det svenska stödet ämnar dock att gå till hela folkräkningen och därmed också ta aktiv del i dialogen under hela projektets gång.
En viktig fråga för Sverige att följa i programmet är hantering av etnicitet, religion och andra eventuellt känsliga ämnen. Ambassaden ämnar också bevaka och driva genderstatistikens roll under projektet - där inte bara könsuppdelad insamlad data är viktig utan också den efterföljande analysen och spridningen av genderrelaterad statistik.

Burkina Faso is about to carry out a population and housing census that will be carried out in 2016 to 2018. The census is a total head-count of the population present in the country under a certain, limited time period (often a week or two) where specific socio-economic caracteristics are collected. The burkinabée census is highly relevant for the production of poverty- and development-related data which in its turn is neccessary for policy and decision making as well as proper accountability mechanisms.The donor collective is gathered around the census through UNFPA. With this contribution Sweden strengthens its engagement in democratic governance and statistical capacity building together with the already ongoing support to INSD through Statistics Sweden.

The project's specific objectives, output and activities have been defined. Eight specific objectives are: 1°) to know the overall size of the population, its structure by sex and age and its spatial distribution according to the different administrative units and residence area and its evolution2°) to determine the levels and trends of fertility, mortality and migration as well as the increase in global population and natural3°) to contribute to a better understanding of the demographic, socio-economic and cultural characteristics of the population and its components4°) to update the national survey database for the achievement of the potential surveys5°) to update agricultural survey database 6°) to contribute to a better understanding of households characteristics of and their living and housing conditions7°) to contribute to the better knowledge of population development8°) to strengthen national capacity in planning, data collection, processing, analysis and dissemination. In order to reach these some activities have been idenfied: census maps, population enumeration, data capture, processing, analysis, preparation of reports and dissemination. A plan that summarizes the major phases of the Census has been developed.

description.narrative: The activities of the population census experienced a slowdown in their implementation during the first half of 2020 due to the coronavirus pandemic. This is the case of the post-census survey (EPC) whose implementation, initially scheduled to start in April 2020, could not be effective until June 2020 following the reduction in measures to fight COVID19. The Post-Enumeration Survey was carried out in June 2020. This survey made it possible to assess the coverage of the census and make adjustments to the data. It allowed to measure the accuracy of the census by independently surveying a sample of the population. The survey estimates how many people and housing units were missed or counted erroneously in the census. Because of insecurity, out of a total number of 368 municipalities and districts, 9 municipalities were not enumerated and 52 were partially enumerated, including 23 municipalities with a satisfactory level of coverage of the enumeration. These are 2 communes of Bam (Zimtenga and Nasséré), 4 of Sanmatenga (Barsalogho, Namissiguima, Pensa and Dablo), 2 of Yagha (Boundoré and Mansila) and one commune of Soum (Koutougou). For these municipalities a hybrid census combining the use of satellite images and other information made it possible to produce the demographic estimates. The lack of data in areas not covered or partially enumerated due to insecurity was filled by INSD with technical support from Geo-referenced infrastructure and demographic data for development (GRID), which carried out population size estimates. The preliminary results of the 5th RGPH were published on December 22, 2020. These results were presented according to the administrative division (region, province, municipality) by age group, sex, urban and rural environment. A report of these results and a leaflet were produced and shared with several institutions and the report is available on the INSD website. According to these preliminary results of the 5th RGPH in Burkina Faso, the total resident population is 20,487,979 inhabitants. These figures include the homeless population (floating population) and that of Burkina Faso's representations abroad (embassies and consulates). This population is made up of 9,894,028 men and 10,593,951 women, i.e. 51.7% of the resident population.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
